Fast Bayesian Inference for Change-Point Detection

mich is an R package that implements the Multiple Independent Change-Point (MICH) method introduced in Berlind, Cappello, Madrid Padilla (2025). The main function in the package mich() takes a length TT sequence of observations ùê≤1:T\mathbf{y}_{1:T} with potentially many change-points in the mean and variance, and deploys a backfitting procedure to find a variational approximation to the posterior distribution of the change-points.

Installation

You can install the development version of mich from GitHub using:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("davis-berlind/mich")
